text: <!here|@here>: in jira tickets for upcoming sprints i’m trying to use use stories and see if this can catch on with client.  let me know if this is NOT helpful.  i feel that its worked well for us in the past

<!here|@here>: as discussed, until our estimation meeting it’s a good use of peter’s time to de-bug the lack of initials on bubbles on Wall.  <@U0J6TE0CA> will be doing an independent audit of the experience as well, sending me any findings

<@U0EL0GLEL>: got this in Myles’ feedback:

PS1, Line 184:
angular.element("#circle_"+$scope.questionID+"_"+$scope.answerID+" .fill").css(transform_styles[i], 'rotate('
+ fill_rotation + 'deg)');
              :
angular.element("#circle_"+$scope.questionID+"_"+$scope.answerID+" .mask.full").css(transform_styles[i], 'rotate('
+ fill_rotation + 'deg)');
              :
angular.element("#circle_"+$scope.questionID+"_"+$scope.answerID+" .fill.fix").css(transform_styles[i], 'rotate('
+ fix_rotation + 'deg)');
It's generally a bad practice to access dom from a controller.  A better
option here would be to use the element parameter of the link method.
How much do we care/is it worth fixing?
that seems like a pretty big change
<!here|@here>: just pushed linting updates to dev
SHOULD be a non-issue, purely cosmetic, but let’s verify when we get a chance on-wall
<@U02E3CRMA>: does that mean we are pushing back on that piece of feedback?
